Review Title: Great hotel with large suites and convenient, excessive street noise comes through the windows.
Negative Reviews:
The windows are single-pane and don't seal properly.  As a result, street noise comes into the suite even with the windows shut.  The noise level overall is very high - day & night (motorcycles, buses) on both east (orient) and west (occident).

On the east side of the building, there's a bar on the other side of the street that plays very loud music until 4 am on most nights, and this comes through the windows even when closed.  Some nights were karaoke so the sound is not always very pleasant to hear.

I stayed at the hotel a couple of times a few years ago on different floors, and it was the same level as sound carries up.

If that wasn't bad enough for noise, the hotel installed a party/conference room on the 4th floor, and there were several parties with very loud music from 6 pm until 10 pm a few nights.  We didn't know about the parties.  We couldn't use the suite during that time in peace - I couldn't work, I needed to make some calls and I had difficulty hearing the person on the phone due to the high level of the music from the party room (even with the windows shut).

The water system is problematic sometimes; it looks like it's due to heavy concentrated use.  On four occasions during our stay, there was no cold water available in the shower, the water was scolding hot, and it was impossible to shower.  We waited some mornings before the cold water came back - various intervals from 15 minutes to 45 minutes.  This was not an issue every single time so it's an issue with heavy use when the hotel is busy.

Street noise in Bogota is a problem on busy streets in general, however, at this hotel, the noise level was excessive overall and the hotel could benefit by upgrading windows.

We've stayed at this hotel a few times over the years however the next time we visit Bogot√°, we'll be looking for another hotel due to the noise level that comes into the suites.
Positive Reviews:
The suites are large and very convenient for the typical Bogot√° tourist attractions.  The kitchen has a fridge/stove/microwave; however, it doesn't have any pots/plates/utensils provided.  We requested these and got the basics to make some quick meals occasionally (we were there for ten days in total).  

Breakfast was included and was buffet style.  Great value.  

The spa is fine and operated by a different company; the jacuzzi, dry sauna and steam room were included.  Due to the size of the hotel, we were told we could only use the spa every second day.  

There is a small gym with typical modern equipment.  It was upgraded since our last stay.  

The staff are friendly and professional overall.  

If you want a great view of the mountains, the east side is best.  

If you can withstand the noise (read what I didn't like below) then this hotel is a great place as the suites are big and so convenient.  Bring earplugs if you aren't a deep sleeper.
